snippet: Philipp M. Hildebrand, head of the Swiss central bank, said he regretted the trades that have clouded his reputation but maintained he broke no laws or regulations.
abstract: Philipp M. Hildebrand, head of the Swiss central bank, says he regrets currency trades that have threatened his reputation as an advocate for tougher bank regulation, but maintains he violated no laws or regulations and will not resign.
lead_paragraph: Philipp M. Hildebrand, head of the Swiss central bank, said he regretted the trades that have clouded his reputation but maintained he broke no laws or regulations.

headline.main: Swiss Bank Chief Vows Not to Resign Over Currency Trades
headline.print_headline: Swiss Bank Chief Says He Did Nothing Illegal
